CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 2, 1961, pg. 3, reads: "Sub-Standard - This building, located at 4628 Forbes St., Oakland, was inspected by the city on Jan. 25, 1961, and found to be sub-standard. Although it was leased by Smith, the owner was listed as the Jacob Aronson Company, 3358 Fifth Ave. - Harris Photo."  Portion of accompanying article reads: "DePaul Smith...A Liability or Asset?  Editor's note: While Pittsburgh (The Renaissance City) proudly displays its renovation of the Golden Triangle, highlights by the $22 million Civic Arena, to its many citizens and visitors, and maps magnificent plans for 'urban renewal, it has 'swept under the rug its 'dregs of human misery' - those displaced persons, a majority of whom are Negroes, who either have not been relocated or are unable to find suitable housing on their own.  Crack Courier reporter Phyl Garland has gone behind the scenes to interview and write about these 'Prisoners of the Ghetto' and their vicious 'jailer.'  This is the second in a series of articles which The Courier offers its readers..."
TitMainTitle: Brick and frame building with dilapidated wooden walkway, balcony with mop leaning over railing, and overgrown trees, 4628 Forbes Avenue, Oakland
